diff_analysis.evidence: In the OLD code, serializers (JsonSerializer/JsonbSerializer) used fastjson2 with autoType enabled and only a broad default allow list ("com", "org", "io") and allowed overriding it via allowPackageList. NettyEncoder/NettyDecoder enforced that deserialized objects match an expected genericClass, but fastjson2 autoType with SupportClassForName still allows instantiation of arbitrary classes under allowed packages from untrusted data. This is a deserialization of untrusted data issue (CWE-502) that the NEW code partially mitigates by removing the configurable allowPackageList and tightening serializer usage, while also simplifying encoder/decoder type checks.
